comment.author: 47393018@N00
comment._content: Duff Gordon "Sir Richard" Cooley (March 29, 1873 - August 9, 1937) played Major League baseball primarily as an outfielder, although over the course of his career he played games at every defensive position except pitcher. Cooley was born in Leavenworth, KS. Cooley hit for the cycle on June 20, 1904. Cooley died of a heat stroke in Dallas, TX.[1] He was laid to rest at Grove Hill Memorial Park in Dallas, TX.[2] en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duff_Cooley www.baseball-reference.com/c/cooledu01.shtml www.baseball-almanac.com/players/player.php?p=cooledu01
